title: Program Manager
content:
About Ogilvy  
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry.
About the Role 
Our Program Managers are responsible for the exceptional delivery of our products for partnering with client services to deliver operational discipline and delivery excellence, speed to market, resource optimization, and profitability management to their business(es). Program Managers handle a wide range of assignments, projects, and/or clients with a high degree of success and independence. They take responsibility for the projects they manage, demonstrate leadership skills, and have strong internal team relationships. The ideal candidate is passionate about solving our clients’ problems with strategic and creative solutions.  Clients choose Ogilvy because we help brands increase their impact in Washington – and Washington based clients build brands whose impact stretches around the globe.  Team members join Ogilvy in DC because they love the breadth and challenge of our client work, the rich heritage of Ogilvy, and the people.
*This is a hybrid role, with in office expectation of 3 days per week*
 
What you’ll do?

Growing/protecting margins along with client services - including joint ownership of locally agreed targets
Understanding and anticipating client needs; taking them into account when framing and making Delivery decisions
Working with Group PMO to ensure right resource allocation and management on any given program/project
Drafting and owning Delivery project plans (timeline, budget, scope of work, staff plan) spanning client services, strategy, creative, production, media, measurement
Accurately identifying types of work and scopes, timing, difficulty of work and defining the processes necessary to get things done, simplifying complex processes
Support the project management/workflow system with data entry, reporting, and initial analysis (e.g., capacity plans, resourcing, financial projections)
Demonstrating strong collaboration skills with internal agency team and key external partners, including creative partners to ensure quality and adherence to production guidelines for key deliverables
Mentoring team members including associates and interns, assigning clear responsibility for tasks and decisions; setting clear objectives.
Developing and maintaining high levels of team effectiveness (trust, communication, collaboration, productivity, diversity, engagement)
Ensuring high quality delivery process and execution
Understanding/ability to activate agency matrix and portfolio
Developing and maintaining high levels of team effectiveness (trust, communication, collaboration, productivity, diversity, engagement)

 
What You’ll Need:

6+ years of experience with managing programs across several accounts
Experience with Smartsheet or other project and resource management tools a plus
Innovative mindset and change agent who is never satisfied with the status quo
Seeks out and is receptive to feedback. Learns from and applies feedback by making suggested improvements and adjustments in work performance
Ability to take initiative, think independently, and exercise sound judgment yet knows when to seek advice of supervisor and other team member
Manages time for optimum productivity, understanding appropriate time commitments on projects
Agency experience required

 
How We’ll Support You
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
